intro: Stenia wendiae, commonly known as the Wendia stenia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
